intro: Heisteria parvifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf heister, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. The varietal form angustifolia is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to the typical variety.
